name: sfchronicle
text: @pfimrite Police rushed to the scene at the church, at 484 East San Fernando St., shortly after 9 p.m. Sunday and found multiple victims, the police tweeted over their media relations channel. https://t.co/FlZ36NTDUy

name: sfchronicle
text: ‚ÄúFor clarification, no church services were being conducted at the time of the stabbing.‚Äù police said. ‚ÄúUnhoused individuals were brought into the church to get them out of the cold.‚Äù https://t.co/FlZ36NTDUy

name: sfchronicle
text: @KateGalbraith ‚ÄúLate Friday evening, @JenSiebelNewsom and I learned that 3 of our children had been exposed to an officer from the California Highway Patrol who had tested positive for COVID-19,‚Äù Newsom tweeted Sunday. https://t.co/SrbvKFavn0

name: sfchronicle
text: @KateGalbraith A Newsom spokesperson said Newsom and Siebel Newsom ‚Äúhad no direct interaction with the officer. The family were all tested today and are all negative for COVID-19. However, consistent with local guidance, the family has begun to quarantine.‚Äù https://t.co/SrbvKFavn0
